questions.question: What is the difference between == and === operators in JavaScript?
choice: == performs type coercion, while === does not.
== only checks for equality of value, while === also checks for equality of data type.
== is used for strict equality comparison, while === is used for loose equality comparison.
== and === operators are exactly the same in JavaScript.
